article:
Events

January *January 1 â Julia Fischer makes her dÃ©but as a concert pianist,
performing Edvard Grieg's [[Piano Concerto (Grieg)|Piano Concerto in A minor]]
with the Junge Deutsche Philharmonie at the Alte Oper, Frankfurt. The concert
was conducted by Matthias Pintscher, who replaced Sir Neville Marriner. On the
same occasion she also performed the [[Violin Concerto No. 3 (Saint-
SaÃ«ns)|Violin Concerto no. 3 in B minor]] by Camille Saint-
SaÃ«ns. [http://www.signandsight.com/features/1636.html Arno Widmann: "Julia
Fischer: Virtuosissima!!!", Frankfurter Rundschau, 2 January 2008. Retrieved 10
October 2012] *January 5 â The Salzburg Festival launches the "Herbert
von Karajan Jubilee Year" with a concert in Salzburg's Grosses
Festspielhaus. Agence France Presse, January 4, 2008. *January 12 â
The Vienna Boys' Choir begins a tour of South Korea with a concert at Sejong
Center for the Performing Arts in Seoul. Anon., "Concerts, Museums &
Performances", Korea Times (January 3, 2008). *January 29 ** Face to Face
announce that they will reunite for select shows in the US and
internationally. ** Rage Against the
Machine headline the Big Day Out festivals in Australia and New Zealand, their
first shows outside the United States since reforming, and their first
Australian shows in 12 years. *January 31 **Laura Attwood of the
King Edward VI School in Morpeth wins the second Eileen Bowler
Award. Anon., "Top Music Award for Morpeth Girl", The Morpeth Herald
(January 31, 2008). **Taylor Swift wins album of the year for her second
album, Fearless. Swift's Album of the Year win made her the youngest person
ever at the age of 20 to receive that award.

February *February 8 â Michael Jackson's Thriller album, the world's best-
selling album of all time, is reissued as [[Thriller 25]] to celebrate its 25th
anniversary, with Jackson himself as executive producer. *February 10
â The 50th Grammy Awards ceremony takes place at the Staples Center in Los
Angeles, USA. [http://www.grammy.com/Recording_Academy/Fifty_Years Official
Grammy site]  *February 19 â System of a Down guitarist, Daron Malakian,
tells MTV.com that the band is not likely to reform as he will be concentrating
on his new project Scars on Broadway. *February 20â25 â ViÃ±a del Mar
International Song Festival is held in Chile. *February 23 â March 3
â The second annual Soundwave festival is held in Australia.
*February 26 â The Return of the Spice Girls tour comes to a close in Toronto.

March *March 6â9 â The 2008 Langerado Music Festival is held on the Big Cypress
Indian Reservation in southern Florida. [http://www.langerado.com/home2.php
Welcome to Langerado!: Langerado Music Festival March 6â9, 2008 Big Cypress, FL:
Home]  *March 7 â The Jakarta International Java Jazz Festival 2008 takes
place in Indonesia. *March 7â16 â The 2008 South by Southwest
Conference and Festival is held in Austin, Texas, USA. *March 11 â
Jazz musician and broadcaster Humphrey Lyttelton announces his retirement from
presenting BBC Radio 2's jazz programme after forty years. *March
25â29 â Miami Winter Music Conference. *March 31 â theJazz radio
station stops broadcasting. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/7238444.stm
BBC News: "Two GCap digital stations closed", 11 February 2008. Retrieved 10
October 2012.]

April *April 1 â Scott Weiland's departure from rock band Velvet Revolver
becomes official. Weiland's reunion with his former band, Stone
Temple Pilots, and tensions between Weiland and the rest of Velvet Revolver, led
to his departure. *April 5 â The reunited Face to Face perform
together for the first time in four-and-a-half-years at The Bamboozle Left in
Irvine, California, USA. *April 12 â "Touch My
Body" becomes Mariah Carey's 18th number 1 single on the Billboard Hot 100,
pushing her into second place among artists with the most number 1 singles in
the rock era and first place as a solo artist in the same category, surpassing
Elvis Presley. *April 15 â Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa officially proclaims
Mariah Carey Day in Los Angeles, California, USA. *April 22 â Andrey
Baranov of Russia wins First Prize in the Second Benjamin Britten International
Violin Competition in London. [http://www.violina2z.com/english/comp.html#6
Main International Violin Competitions]; [http://www.britten-competition.co.uk/
The Second Benjamin Britten International Violin Competition, London, April
14â22, 2008]. 

May *May 3 **Girls Aloud begin their Tangled Up Tour in Belfast, UK.
**The sixth annual The Bamboozle festival opens at the Meadowlands Sports
Complex, East Rutherford, New Jersey, USA. *May 10â11 â The Give It A Name 2008
festival is held at Earls Court, London, UK. *May 14 â The "Spirit of
Change" Gospel Choir celebrates its tenth anniversary with the 20th ZÃ¼ndorfer
Gospelnacht concert in the Catholic Parish Church of St. Mariae Geburt, in
ZÃ¼ndorf. Roland Schriefer, "[http://www.spirit-of-change.de/clips/KStA-
20080515.jpg SÃ¤nger zeigen viel GefÃ¼hl: Chor feiert zehnjÃ¤hriges Bestehen mit
20. ZÃ¼ndorfer Gospelnacht]", KÃ¶lner Stadt-Anzeiger (May 15, 2008); Nadine
Hantke, "[http://www.spirit-of-change.de/clips/KRS-20080515.jpg Eine
Erfolgsgeschichte]: 'Spirit of Chance' feierte bei 20. Gospelnacht Geburtstag"
KÃ¶lnische Rundschau (May 15, 2008); K. M., "'Spirit of Change' feierte 10.
Geburtstag", Porz Aktuell (May 28, 2008). *May 17 â The sixteenth annual
KROQ Weenie Roast is held at the Verizon Wireless Amphitheatre, Irvine,
California, USA. *May 21 â David Cook defeats David Archuleta to win season 7 of
''American Idol'', in a contest decided by 97.5 million votes, a record for the
show. *May 24 â 43 countries compete in the 2008 Eurovision Song Contest final
in Belgrade, Serbia, including newcomers San Marino and Azerbaijan.
The contest is won by Russia, with Believe by Dima Bilan. *May 24â26 â The
Sasquatch! Music Festival is held over Memorial Day weekend at The Gorge
Amphitheatre in central Washington, USA. *May 25 â The Slovak preliminary round
of the first Bluegrass competition (toward the annual Czech Festival Banjo
Jamboree) is held in Hviezdoslavovo nÃ¡mestie, Bratislava. "[http://www.twin-
cityjournal.eu/vismo/dokumenty2.asp?id_org=600185&id=1200&p1=1141 Koncerty
2008/05]", Twin City MagazÃ­n (Bratislava) (April 2008). *May 30 â June 1
** Rock In Rio Lisboa 2008 takes place in Parque da Bela Vista, Chelas, Lisbon,
Portugal, continuing on June 5â6. ** The fourth annual Mountain Jam Festival is
held in Hunter Mountain, New York, USA.

June *June 1 â Westlife play their 10th anniversary concert at Europe's fourth
biggest stadium, Croke Park, in Dublin, Republic of Ireland. *June 7
â Prince celebrates his 50th birthday. *June 6â8 â The 2008 Wakarusa Music and
Camping Festival is held at Clinton State Park near Lawrence, Kansas,
USA. *June 10 â Lil Wayne's sixth album [[Tha Carter III]] sells 1
million copies in its first week of release. *June 12â15 â The 2008
Bonnaroo Music Festival is held in Manchester, Tennessee, USA. *June
13â15 â The seventh Isle of Wight Festival takes place in Seaclose Park,
Newport, Isle of Wight, UK. *June 15 â E. Kallai from Hungary wins
First Prize in the 11th Carl Fleisch International Violin Competition in
MosonmagyarÃ³vÃ¡r, Hungary. *June 20 â My Bloody Valentine play their
first reunion show at the Roundhouse, London, UK.  *June 27â29 â The
EidgenÃ¶ssiches Jodlerfest is held in Lucerne. Petra Hofmann, "[http://www.jodlerbiel-
benken.ch/berichte.htm#ejf08 EidgenÃ¶ssiches Jodlerfest vom 27. Juni 2008 â 29.
Juni 2008 in Luzern]" . Retrieved January 7, 2010. *June 29 â Release of
[[Guitar Hero: Aerosmith]], the first video game in the [[Guitar Hero]] series
to be based around a single music group.

July *July 3 â Opening of the O2 Wireless Festival in Hyde Park, London,
UK. *July 5 â Staatsminister Rainer Robra and Halberstadt
OberbÃ¼rgermeister Andreas Henke preside as the notes A and C are added in the
sixth sound change of the performance of John Cage's [[As Slow as
Possible|OrganÂ²/ASLSP (As SLow aS Possible)]] that began on 5 September 2001 and
is to conclude on 5 September 2640, in Halberstadt, Germany. "Orgelmarathon:
Endlich neue TÃ¶neDie Zeit (7 July 2008). *July 23â26 â The 2008 10,000
Lakes Festival is held. *July 24â28 â The Fifth International
Symposium of throat-singing, "KhoomeiâCultural Phenomenon of the Peoples of
Central Asia" is held in Tuva. Ministry of Culture of Tuva,
"[http://en.tuvaonline.ru/2008/07/11/4753_khoomei.html Tuva Preparing to Host
Throat Singing Admirers from all over the World]" (July 11, 2008) . Retrieved
January 7, 2010.

August *August 1â3 â The Lollapalooza music festival takes place in Chicago,
USA. *August 8 - Chen Qigang is director of music for the 2008 Summer Olympics
opening ceremony in Beijing. A minor scandal ensues when it is
revealed that Lin Miaoke, the performer of "Ode to the Motherland", was miming
to a recording by another girl, Yang Peiyi. *August 10 â Jimmy Dean
and Eddie Fisher celebrate their 80th birthdays. *August 12â18 â Sziget Festival
2008 takes place in Budapest, Hungary. *August 13 â Jeff Singer quits Paradise
Lost. http://www.paradiselost.co.uk/news/2008/statement-from-jeff-aug-
13.html *August 16 â Madonna celebrates her 50th birthday. *August 22 -
Coke Live Music Festival opens in Poland with artists such as Sean Paul,
Timbaland and The Prodigy performing. *August 23 **Madonna starts her Sticky &
Sweet Tour which is set to become the highest-grossing tour for both a female
and solo artist. **Michael Nicklasson quits Dark Tranquility *August 24 **Mason
Williams celebrates his 70th birthday. **Season 6 of the television talent
contest [[Australian Idol]] begins. *August 29 â Michael Jackson celebrates his
50th birthday. *August 30 ** Filipino rock band Eraserheads hold their one-night-
only reunion concert in the Fort open field, their first concert since 2001.
After the 20-minute break, vocalist Ely Buendia is rushed to the hospital
because of chest pain due to emotional stress. ** [[American Idol]] Season 7 runner-
up David Archuleta's debut single "Crush" scores the highest debut of a song on
the Billboard Hot 100 by an American Idol finalist not performed on the show.
The track opened at No. 2 after selling 166,000 downloads in its first week of
release. *August 31 â Chrome Division fires Eddie Guz.

September *September 6 â Six members of The Specials re-unite at the Bestival as
a 'Surprise Act'. They use the name "Terry Hall and Friends", because Jerry
Dammers, who owns the band's name, did not participate. *September 7 â The 2008
MTV Video Music Awards event took place at Paramount Studios, Hollywood also
being called Britney Spears' night who won the awards for Video of the Year,
Best Pop Video and Best Female Video for Piece of Me. Christina Aguilera also
made her return to music since giving birth to her first child with the debut of
her single Keeps Gettin' Better. *September 9 â Jessica Simpson releases her
first album in 2 years, [[Do You Know (Jessica Simpson album)|Do You Know]], her
first country album. The album goes straight in at No. 1 in the Billboard
Country Charts and at No. 4 in the Billboard 200 with sales of 65,000.
*September 10 â The 22nd Annual ARIA Music Awards are held in Sydney, Australia,
recognizing Australian music in 2008. Dance-punk group The Presets win Album of
the Year. *September 11 â Christian Ãlvestam leaves Scar Symmetry. *September 12
â Season 4 of the Finnish talent contest, [[Idols (Finland)|Idols]], begins.
*September 15 â Kris Drever, John McCusker and Roddy Woomble release [[Before
the Ruin]]. *September 18 **Soilwork hires former member, Peter Wichers, to
replace Daniel Antonsson, who is fired. ** Ben Folds Five play a sold
out reunion show in Chapel Hill, NC, performing the entirety of their 1999 album
[[The Unauthorized Biography of Reinhold Messner]], that was filmed for DVD and
web release by MySpace in benefit for Operation Smile *** Crystal
Castles play their biggest headline show to date, at Electric Ballroom in
Camden, London. *September 19 â Travis Barker and Adam Goldstein (DJ AM) survive
a plane crash that claims four lives. [http://cnnwire.blogs.cnn.com/2008/09/20/investigation-on-in-deadly-
sc-plane-crash/ Investigation on in deadly SC plane crash]. [[CNN]].com, 2008-09-
20. Retrieved 2008-09-21. *September 20 â Pink scores her first solo number-
one hit in her native USA, with "So What". *September 21 **At the Gates play
their final Show. **The Eric Burdon show in Oklahoma is cancelled due his health
problems. *September 24 â Within Temptation release Black Symphony DVD,
featuring the Metropole Orchestra and guest musicians. *September 25 â Former
Beatle Paul McCartney performs at Tel Aviv park, his first performance in Israel
since The Beatles were banned from the country in 1965.

October *October 1 â Tina Turner leaves semi-retirement to embark on her
[[Tina!: 50th Anniversary Tour]], which grossed over US$130 million
dollars. *October 5 â Stephanie Jeong wins the Second Prize (no First
Prize was awarded) in the Premio Paganini international violin competition in
Genoa. [http://www.violina2z.com/english/comp.html#6 Main International
Violin Competitions]. *October 10 â The Fourth Waakirchener Zither
Festival takes place in Waakirchen, Bavaria. "[http://www.kkb-
waakirchen.de/veranstaltung_detail.php?id=24 October 10, 2008â4.
Zitherfestival]". Retrieved January 7, 2010. *October 12 â Opening of the
VII Festival Internazionale di Musica e Arte Sacra, in Rome and the Vatican City
(until November
30,). "[http://www.festivalmusicaeartesacra.net/en/festival_uebersicht.php
VII Festival Internazionale di Musica e Arte Sacra: October 12, â November 30,
2008]" . Retrieved January 7, 2010.  *October 16 â Britney Spears sets a
new record for the biggest jump to number one on the Billboard Hot 100, rising
from number 96 to number one in just one week, with her single "Womanizer". It
is Spears' first American number one since her debut single "...Baby One More
Time". It also garnered first-week download sales of 286,000, the
biggest opening-week tally by a female artist. *October 18 â Rihanna scores her
fifth number one song on the Billboard Hot 100 (as a featured artist on T.I.'s
"Live Your Life", which followed "SOS", "Umbrella", "Take a Bow", and
"Disturbia"), becoming the leading solo female artist with the most number ones
to have charted in this decade Until BeyoncÃ© Knowles broke her record (as a solo
artist).

November *November 1â9 â The Southbank Centre in London, UK presents "Klang: A
Tribute to Stockhausen", a festival curated by Oliver Knussen, with a series of
concerts focusing on works from the composer's last decade, including the world
premieres of [[Klang (Stockhausen)#Nineteenth Hour: Urantia|Urantia]] and
[[Tierkreis (Stockhausen)|Zodiac for Orchestra]], as well as late-night
performances, lectures, and master classes. "News: Stockhausen Tribute in
the UK", Computer Music Journal 33, no. 2 (2009): 6. *November 2 â The
Fauxharmonic Orchestra loses in its debut confrontation with the Baltimore
Chamber Orchestra in a Bargemusic concert. Steve Smith, "Dueling Maestros,
One Wielding a Wii", [[The New York Times]] (November 4, 2008): C7.
*November 6 â Michael Tilson Thomas makes his Philadelphia Orchestra subscription-
concert conducting debut. Peter Dobrin, "After 23 Years, a Return to
Phila.", The Philadelphia Inquirer (November 8, 2008): E04. *November 17
â Korean violinist Hyun-Su Shin wins First Prize in the Jacques Thibaud
International Violin Competition in Paris *November 24 â The Royal
Philharmonic Orchestra announces the appointment of Pinchas Zukerman as
principal guest conductor, to begin in January 2009. Dave Itzkoff,
"Zukerman Appointed To Royal Philharmonic", [[The New York Times]] (November
24, 2008): C2.

December *December 9 â Damon Albarn and Graham Coxon say that Blur will reunite
for a concert at Hyde Park on July 3, 2009. Tickets for the concert sell out
within two minutes of release, and Blur announce another date on July 2,
2009. Paine, Andre. [http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266135/blur-reuniting-unveils-london-
show-plans "Blur Reuniting, Unveils London Show Plans"]. billboard.com. December
9, 2008. {{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/hi/music/news-
id_7771000/7771915.stm|title=Blur confirm massive outdoor show
|accessdate=December 10, 2008 |publisher=BBC |date=December 9, 2008 |
archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20081212085616/http://news.bbc.co.uk/new-
sbeat/hi/music/newsid_7771000/7771915.stm| archivedate= December 12, 2008 | deadurl= no}} *December 11 â Elliott Carter celebrates his 100th
birthday. *December 13 â BeyoncÃ© Knowles scores her fifth number one song on the
Billboard Hot 100 with "Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)", which followed "Crazy
in Love", "Baby Boy", "Check on It", and "Irreplaceable", tying with Rihanna as
the leading solo female artist with the most number ones to have charted in this
decade. *December 22 â Live Nation announce that
Madonna's Sticky & Sweet Tour is the highest-grossing tour for solo artist with
US$280 million in ticket sales and 2,350,282 fans attending the 58 shows during
the 3 leg tour across Europe and the Americas.
